IncidentReport.title: IncidentReport
IncidentReport.description: Represents a report of a GBV incident submitted by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the incident report.

userId.description: Reference to the User who submitted the report. (Relationship: User 1:N IncidentReport)

incidentType.description: Type of incident reported (e.g., physical assault, harassment).

incidentDate.description: Date and time when the incident occurred.

location.description: Location where the incident occurred (e.g., address, city).

anonymous.description: Indicates whether the report was submitted anonymously.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the report was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the report was last updated.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, DBAC, and QAPs. It leverages path-based ownership for user-specific data and denormalization to avoid `get()` calls in security rules.  Specifically, IncidentReports are stored under `/users/{userId}/incident_reports/{reportId}`, enforcing ownership and enabling secure list operations (QAPs) as rules can easily filter based on `request.auth.uid == userId`. Resources are stored in the `/resources/{resourceId}` collection, enabling global access. Community Posts are stored in the `/community_posts/{postId}` collection, and access is controlled by `request.auth.uid == resource.data.userId`. No `get()` calls are required in the security rules due to this structure, and list operations are secured.
